timeline.bodyText: I don't support spurious changes like this
timeline.author: markxnelson

replies.bodyText: Yeah, I fixed the CheckStyle errors.  I'm not sure why these aren't being caught when others commit.  @ddsharpe, any ideas?
replies.author: rjeberhard

replies.bodyText: I fully support changes like this.  This is technical debt resolution.  The original code did not meet our coding standard, and is therefore technical debt.  The code was originally allowed in because nobody caught it, and the checkstyle implementation was flawed.
replies.author: ddsharpe

timeline.author: markxnelson

replies.bodyText: Same, technical debt resolution.  Ok by me.
replies.author: ddsharpe

timeline.bodyText: this documentation does not tell me anything more that the variable name did
timeline.author: markxnelson
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -19,11 +18,11 @@
   private String dirPath;
 
   /**
-   * Create PV directory and k8s pv and pvc for the domain
+   * Create PV directory and k8s pv and pvc for the domain.
    *
-   * @param dirPath
-   * @param pvMap
-   * @throws Exception
+   * @param dirPath directory path

replies.bodyText: Right... again, this was CheckStyle.  It's a CS issue if you have JavaDoc but without text.
replies.author: rjeberhard

timeline.bodyText: this makes me nervous - can you explain more about why we do this?
timeline.author: markxnelson

replies.bodyText: Yes, we've had this behavior for a while.  It's even recommended in the client sample watch.  You don't want the HTTP request timing out underneath a watch that doesn't have any traffic for a long time.
replies.author: rjeberhard

timeline.bodyText: this seems to repeat a lot - can this not be refactored?
timeline.author: markxnelson

timeline.bodyText: i would like to see a comment here explaining why - for future generations of developers
timeline.author: markxnelson
markxnelson

timeline.bodyText: We're generally using String.isNullOrEmpty rather than this combination
timeline.author: russgold
